text: Since MMPs are primarily secreted by leukocytes (white blood cells, WBCs), including neutrophils and monocytes [33], we tested whether NS1 could induce MMP secretion in human leukocytes, peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs), and THP-1 human monocytes.

subject: GOPC

subject: AMH
text: As MIF is a crucial mediator of NS1-induced vascular leakage and an upstream regulator of MMP-9 [19, 26, 34, 35], we tested whether NS1-induced MMP-9 secretion in leukocytes is also MIF dependent.

text: TIMP-1, which is a potent inhibitor of MMPs, can form a complex with pro-MMP-9 at a 1:1 stoichiometric relationship to inhibit its activation [44, 45].

subject: IVNS1ABP
text: DENV NS1 may bind to the TLR4 of leukocytes, inducing the secretion of cytokines and MMPs, or it may directly bind to endothelial cells, inducing the secretion of HPA-1, both of which can cause glycocalyx degradation and subsequent vascular leakage.
